@dberkholz IMHO: #remotework has huge benefits for employers and employees. It also allows us to rethink the role of the office for team-building, collaboration, and a new level of customer engagement and experience. (Hence the keep analysts close part.)

@reillyusa @hapster84 @barryschiffer Facts:
1. When the workforce went home, productivity went up.
2. Studies show remote work gives back 6+ hours/week -- >1/2 of that time is spent working.
3. Hybrid-work success requires equitable tech & work policies so employees can work anywhere without disadvantages.

Want to create a productive workplace without employee burnout? Value clear outcomes above always-on culture; encourage experimentation and (gasp!) failure: https://t.co/plqh3QDKt7 https://t.co/LNYp4gJ5wa
Harsh fact: The tech designed to manage business is distracting you from doing your best, focused work. Smart firms adopting #DigitalWorkspace to tame it.
#4 Tech matters - a third of workers who left their jobs did so because they were frustrated with their employers' complex tech and processes.
#3 It ain't all about the money - Nearly half of workers that took on new jobs did so for the opportunity to do more meaningful work.
#2 Productivity must be balanced with well-being - 70% of IT leaders say their teams are struggling with extra work hours, resulting in higher turnover and decreased job satisfaction.
#1 Flexible work = #FutureOfWork - 80% of workers say it is important or very important to be able to work from anywhere. And more than half would accept a pay cut to do so.
We've asked thousands of knowledge workers and 500+ #IT & #Security execs about how work will evolve. This stream offers some key takeaways. But you can read more here:  https://t.co/ci02iouxaJ
